user_message:
<target code>Here is the code that failed to compile:
```c

static enum MHD_Result
queue_auth_required_response3_inner (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                                     const char *realm,
                                     const char *opaque,
                                     const char *domain,
                                     struct MHD_Response *response,
                                     int signal_stale,
                                     enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiQOP mqop,
                                     enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3 malgo3,
                                     int userhash_support,
                                     int prefer_utf8,
                                     char **buf_ptr,
                                     struct DigestAlgorithm *da)
{
  FILE *log_file = fopen("/tmp/logs/573.txt", "a");
  if (log_file) {
    fprintf(log_file, "Entered queue_auth_required_response3_inner\n");
    fprintf(log_file, "Initial malgo3 value: %d\n", (int)malgo3);
  }

  /* Violation: modifying the parameter malgo3 */
  if (0 == (((unsigned int) malgo3) & MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_NON_SESSION))
  {
    if (log_file) fprintf(log_file, "malgo3 failed NON_SESSION check\n");
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              _ ("Only non-'session' algorithms are supported.\n"));
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */
    if (log_file) fclose(log_file);
    return MHD_NO;
  }

  malgo3 =
    (enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3)
    (malgo3
     & (~((enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3) MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_NON_SESSION)));

  if (log_file) {
    fprintf(log_file, "Modified malgo3 value: %d\n", (int)malgo3);
    fclose(log_file);
  }

  /* Original logic proceeds unchanged - rest omitted for brevity */

  return MHD_NO;
}

```
</target code>

<instruction>
Please fix the code so that it compiles successfully.

explanation: The original code modified the parameter 'malgo3' directly, which caused a violation (e.g., modifying function parameters declared as enums or potentially const). To fix the compile error while preserving the original logic, I introduced a local variable 'malgo3' initialized to the value of 'malgo3_param'. All modifications were done on this local variable instead of the parameter. The parameter was also renamed to 'malgo3_param' for clarity and to avoid confusion. This change maintains the logic and ensures the function compiles successfully.
